page.title: 13EDUCATION _ PRIVATE SCHOOLS
page.content: There are two private schools in the area. The smaller is St. Andrew's school. It is situated in 54 acres to the west of Tidmarsh. There are 90 pupils and 15 teachers. It opened in 1934. Previously the building was part of an estate belonging to the Watleys, who owned bakeries, breweries, gasworks and waterworks. The estate was sold off in lots in 1934. Pangbourne College was built as a marine training centre. In 1917 it became a boys' school. In the past many pupils joined the Merchant Navy. In the late sixties and early seventies more buildings were added. The school has around 360 pupils, some of whom are boarders. Fees are Â£1,225 for senior boarders. There are 28 teachers. The school covers 240 acres of ground,partly woodland.In 1985, Prince Andrew visited the school.
